Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: We need to produce a BPMN-like textual process model capturing activities, sequence flow, gateways, roles, artifacts, exceptions, and note ambiguities. Should be clear, with lanes for participants: Accounts Payable Clerk (Mary), Purchasing Officer (Dan), Department Manager (Carlos), Accounts Payable Supervisor (Rita), Supplier Relationship Manager (Karen), Supplier (external). Also system: Accounting System.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - IND
Text: We need to list tasks, flows, gateways, data objects.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: We can use a textual notation like: Pool: Invoice Processing Lanes: Supplier, Accounts Payable (Mary), Purchasing (Dan), Manager (Carlos), Supervisor (Rita), Supplier Relationship Manager (Karen), Accounting System. Then list tasks with IDs, description, performer.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Sequence flows with conditions. Gateways: XOR for decisions (e.g., PO present? matches? discrepancy? escalation?).

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE

Name: Validation - IND
Text: Also note ambiguous points: after Purchasing confirmation, Mary schedules payment; some say after manager approval goes back to AP for scheduling.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - IND
Text: We must use LaTeX for any math, but not needed. We must follow formatting rules: no single dollar signs.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
